title: Tryndamere needs a rework WAYYYYY more than Galio does
body: Galio's kit is boring sure, but it's effective and healthy game wise. Hell, it's actually pretty strong right now. Tryndamere is a genuinely toxic champion who is never not frustrating to play against. I don't want to act like I know better than Riot, but why is a perfectly functional champion getting reworked while a toxic one stays the way he is for the next year or two?

replies.body:
A VU is determined by more than just the gameplay involved. Galio is in sore need of new and updated visuals to his model. His spell effects got a pass not long ago, but his model is still pretty subpar to what they have nowadays.

It also might coincide with something. Riot likes to release champions and VUs alongside events (Gangplank for Burning Tides, Taric for Targon, etc). They might have a Demacia event planned and a VU of everyone's favorite Gargoyle Paladin would go well with that.

Nasus's max level wither is unbearable for tryndamere, and all nasus has to do is Q tryndamere for a guaranteed stormraiders proc late game which allows him to disengage whether tryndamere likes it or not (mocking shout won't slow down nasus all that much with stormraiders).

Nasus's main form of damage late game is his stacks, which mocking shout's ad debuff doesn't affect AT ALL.

Nasus's Q is spammableand unimportant. Whereas undying rage can really fuck up a champion like darius who is reliant on his dunk to kill, nasus can just recast his Q over and over and over.

Nasus can half health tryndamere in a single E/Q while building almost pure tank, tryndamere has to build full carry to chunk nasus hard.

Tryndamere's trading is reliant on auto attacking 50 times with a bunch of AS, which, as said earlier, wither really fucks up. Nasus's trading is reliant on a single Q. Nasus can live with LITERALLY a single auto attack for a trade, tryndamere cannot do the same.

Nasus's turret destruction scales infinitely, tryndamere's doesn't.

Both have defensive ultimates, though nasus's not only lasts longer but also gets more and more powerful the longer it's active.

Nasus's sustain scales up to 20% lifesteal for his autos and his Q which also infinitely scales. Tryndamere's sustain is noticeably inferior and removes his rage when used.

No, it doesn't really. He has 3/4 the kit of a mage, and then a passive, ult, attack range, and base stats of a tank. He's intended to combat AP champs and be the "MR tank," but Galio doesn't have anything remotely tanky about his kit that can swing team fights in his favor, other than the ult. His kit is an incohesive mess that's trying to push him in too many directions while missing the goal entirely.
Plus, his ult doesn't exactly scream "anti-mage". Maximum damage is hard to achieve with low attack speed enemies.
